feed.title: NewsTracker: tikrit
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Saddam deputy al-Douri, 'king of clubs', believed killed near Tikrit
entry.summary:
When Tikrit was overrun by the Sunni militant group last June, witnesses said fighters raised posters of Saddam and al-Douri.

Fighters loyal to his Naqshabandi Army as well as former members of Saddam's Baath Party were the main militant force in Tikrit at the time of its capture, local residents told The AP at the time.

Government forces seized control of Tikrit on April 1.

entry.title: 'Saddam deputy' killed near Tikrit
Iraqi forces recapture 2 towns from IS near crucial refinery
entry.summary: Salahuddin province Gov. Raed al-Jabouri says soldiers and allied Shiite militiamen killed al-Douri early Friday in an operation east of the city of Tikrit.

entry.title: Iraq exhumes remains of 164 from mass graves in Saddam Hussein's palace compound in Tikrit
entry.summary: The mass grave sites were discovered after Iraqi forces retook the northern city of Tikrit earlier this month in their biggest victory so far against IS.

entry.title: Iraq exhumes remains of 164 from mass graves in Saddam Hussein's palace compound in Tikrit
entry.summary: The remains were discovered inside former president Saddam Hussein's palace compound in Tikrit, which officials say holds 10 mass graves, while three more are located outside it.

entry.title: Iraq exhumes remains of 164 from Tikrit graves
entry.summary: Iraq has exhumed the remains of 164 people believed to have been massacred by jihadists from mass graves in Tikrit, the human rights ministry said Monday.

entry.title: Iraq starts opening mass graves in Tikrit
entry.summary: When extremists of the so-called Islamic State, also known as ISIS, overran Tikrit in June, officials at the air force academy at Camp Speicher ordered 1,700 cadets to return to their homes.

entry.title: Iraq starts opening mass graves in Tikrit
entry.summary: So far, he said, officials had found 11 mass graves, each containing dozens of bodies, all located in the sprawling complex of palaces in Tikrit, along the Tigris River, north of Baghdad.

entry.title: Exhumation of Iraq's Camp Speicher victim mass graves begins
entry.summary: "The only positive thing is the victory in Tikrit," said, Ali Hamad, whose cousin Kamal went missing at Speicher.

entry.title: Iraqi experts start exhuming bodies at Tikrit mass grave
entry.summary:
The fall of Tikrit was part of the IS onslaught that stunned Iraqi security forces and the military, which melted away as the militants advanced and captured key cities and towns in the country's north and west.

Other videos showed masked gunmen bringing the soldiers to a bloodstained concrete river waterfront inside the presidential palaces complex in Tikrit, shooting them in the head and throwing them into the Tigris River.

entry.title: Iraqi teams start exhuming mass grave of soldiers in Tikrit
entry.summary: An Iraqi official says forensic teams in the newly liberated city of Tikrit have started exhuming bodies from a mass grave believed to contain hundreds of soldiers killed by Islamic State militants last year.

entry.title: Iraqi teams start exhuming mass grave of soldiers in Tikrit
entry.summary:
Kamil Amin, from Iraq's Human Rights Ministry, says work started on Monday on eight locations inside Tikrit's complex of presidential palaces, where much of the killing is believed to have taken place.

IS militants overran Saddam Hussein's hometown last June, capturing around 1,700 soldiers as they were trying to leave Camp Speicher, an air base previously used by U.S. troops on the outskirt of Tikrit.

entry.title: Iraqi mass graves found in Tikrit
Iraq PM says 'only' 152 homes, shops burned in Tikrit
entry.summary: Haider al-Abadi did not specify who burned the structures or when the fires took place, but pro-government militiamen have admitted to torching houses in other recaptured areas and allegedly did so in Tikrit as well.

entry.title: Iraq PM says 'only' 152 homes, shops burned in Tikrit
entry.summary:
Iraq's prime minister said Monday that "only" 152 homes and shops were burned in Tikrit, where pro-government forces have been accused of carrying out abuses after retaking the city.

During the visit, pro-government militiamen looted and put graffiti on shops in central Tikrit while journalists looked on.

entry.title: Winning over the Sunnis next challenge in Iraq after Tikrit victory
entry.summary: Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi has called on security forces to halt looting and vandalism in Tikrit, promising a fund would be established to help residents return to Tikrit.

entry.title: After Tikrit victory, Iraq's new challenge: Win over Sunnis
entry.summary: Efforts to merge small, but symbolic Sunni battalions with the Iraqi military were tested in the Tikrit battle, with as many as 200 men, mainly from al-Jabour tribe, joining government-backed forces.

entry.title: After Tikrit victory, Iraq's new challenge: Win over Sunnis
entry.summary:
But as Tikrit now sits in ruins, still patrolled by fractious Shiite militias, the powerful Sunni tribes remain as distrustful as ever as further offensives in their heartland loom.

With Tikrit taken, Sunni residents in Islamic State-held Anbar province, home to Fallujah, and Nineveh province, home to Mosul, Iraq's second-largest city, expect the Iraqi offensive to now turn its attention to their regions.

entry.title: After Tikrit victory, Iraq's new challenge: Win over Sunnis
After Tikrit victory, Iraq's new challenge: Win over Sunnis
entry.summary: In Tikrit, fighting damaged many homes.

entry.title: Shia fighters leave Tikrit amid looting complaints
entry.summary: "The situation now is calm," said a police major in Tikrit, speaking on condition of anonymity.

entry.title: Shiite Militias Pulled Out Of Tikrit After Looting: Iraqi Officials
entry.summary:
Prime Minister Haidar al-Abadi, a Shi'ite Islamist, met officials from Salahuddin province and took the decision that the paramilitaries had to leave Tikrit.

The Sunni politician said that the looting and burning had stopped on Saturday after "the federal and local police along with (counter-terrorism) troops became responsible for Tikrit's security."

A spokesman for the Shi'ite paramilitary fighters, Karim al-Noori, confirmed that 80 percent of the Shi'ite volunteer fighters had left Tikrit.

entry.title: Shi'ite fighters leave Tikrit after looting: Iraqi officials
entry.summary: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Almost all Shi'ite paramilitaries had left Tikrit on Saturday after locals complained that some fighters had spent several days looting the Sunni city after helping retake it from Islamic State.

entry.title: Shi'ite fighters leave Tikrit under govt deal after looting -Iraq officials
entry.summary: "As of this afternoon, the (paramilitaries) started to leave the city towards the surrounding areas outside," said Ahmed al-Kraim, the head of the council of Tikrit and its province Salahuddin.

entry.title: Iraq's Tikrit, free of the Islamic State, is a city in ruins
entry.summary: People inspect one of Saddam Hussein's palaces in Tikrit, 80 miles (130 kilometers) north of Baghdad, Iraq, Friday, April 3, 2015.

entry.title: Iraq's Tikrit, free of the Islamic State, is a city in ruins
entry.summary: Much remains to be done before Tikrit residents, most of whom are Sunnis, can return.

entry.title: Iraq struggles with devastation in Tikrit after it was freed from the Islamic State group
entry.summary:
TIKRIT, Iraq - In Iraq's Tikrit, liberation from the Islamic State group comes at a heavy price, both in loss of life and in the sheer devastation the militants leave in their wake.

So much about life in Tikrit under the Islamic State group's rule remains unknown.

entry.title: Iraq's Tikrit, free of the Islamic State, is a city in ruins
entry.summary:
He also urged security forces to quickly ensure that normalcy is restored so that Tikrit's residents, most of whom fled the Islamic State onslaught, can return home.

But elsewhere, there is little law and order, and the Shiite militias roam Tikrit streets freely, spray-painting their graffiti and slogans on buildings and homes.

entry.title: Iraqi PM orders crackdown on looting in Tikrit
entry.summary: Prime Minister Haider al-Abbadi's office issued a statement on Friday calling "on the forces in Tikrit to arrest any person" breaking the law there "and to preserve the belongings and facilities in Salahuddin province".

entry.title: Iraq PM orders arrest of vandals in Tikrit
After Iraqi forces take Tikrit, a wave of looting and lynching
entry.summary:
TIKRIT, Iraq (Reuters) - On April 1, the city of Tikrit was liberated from the extremist group Islamic State.

Since its recapture two days ago, the Sunni city of Tikrit has been the scene of violence and looting.

The militia groups spearheaded the start of the Tikrit assault in early March.

Now, the looting and violence in Tikrit threaten to tarnish Abadi's victory.

entry.title: Iraqi premier orders prosecution for looters in Tikrit
entry.summary: BAGHDAD (AP) - Iraqi prime minister Haider al-Abadi says the military will begin arresting and prosecuting anyone who loots abandoned properties in the newly-recaptured city of Tikrit.

entry.title: After expelling IS, Iraqi bomb squads begin clearing Tikrit
entry.summary: "The street linking the city center to the Tikrit University has been secured," he said.

entry.title: After expelling IS, Iraqi bomb squads begin clearing Tikrit
After expelling IS, Iraqi bomb squads begin clearing Tikrit
entry.summary:
The government declared victory in Tikrit on Wednesday over extremists of the Islamic State group, and warned IS militants holding other Iraqi provinces that they would be the next to fall.

Most of Tikrit's residents fled when the fighting began.

It's risky work, Khamis' men acknowledged, but the city needs to be cleared before Tikrit residents can return home.

entry.title: Iraq claims victory over Islamic State in Tikrit
entry.summary:
"Most of Tikrit today is liberated, only small parts remain (outside our control). We will give you the good news in the next few hours after eliminating the pockets that are still in the city," he said.

The U.S. government, which leads a coalition supporting the fight against Islamic State with air strikes, was also upset, both by the sight of an Iranian-backed force leading the fight for Tikrit and by the government's failure to consult it on the plan, the officials said.

entry.title: Iraq claims victory over Islamic State in Tikrit
entry.summary: State television showed Prime Minister Haidar al-Abadi, accompanied by leaders of the army and police, the provincial governor and Shi'ite paramilitary leaders, parading through Tikrit and raising an Iraqi flag.

entry.title: Isis massacre burial sites found in Tikrit
entry.summary:
Iraqi forces which retook Tikrit from the Islamic State group found burial sites Wednesday believed to hold victims of a June massacre in which hundreds of army cadets were executed.

Hadi al-Ameri, the head of the Shiite Badr group of which Ghaban is also a member, had warned at its launch a month ago that the Tikrit operation would be an opportunity to avenge the massacre.

entry.title: Iraqi Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi claims victory against Islamic State in Tikrit
entry.summary: Members of the Iraqi security forces play football in Tikrit after taking it from Islamic State.

entry.title: A history of the Islamic State group as Iraq retakes Tikrit
entry.summary: The monthlong offensive to retake Tikrit, the hometown of Saddam Hussein some 80 miles (130 kilometers) north of Baghdad, is the biggest victory yet for Iraq since the extremists' campaign last summer.

entry.title: Iraq declares victory over Islamic State group in Tikrit
entry.summary: Iraqi forces battled Islamic State militants holed up in downtown Tikrit, going house to house Tuesday in search of snipers and booby traps, and the prime minister announced security forces had reached the s center.

entry.title: Iraq declares victory over Islamic State group in Tikrit
entry.summary: Extremists from the Islamic State group seized Tikrit last summer during its advance across northern and western Iraq.

entry.title: Iraq declares victory over Islamic State group in Tikrit
entry.summary:
Iraqi security forces battled the last remaining pockets of Islamic State militants in Tikrit on Wednesday before the defense minister declared a 'magnificent victory' over the Islamic State group in Tikrit.

TIKRIT, Iraq (AP) - Iraq declared a "magnificent victory" Wednesday over the Islamic State group in Tikrit, a key step in driving the militants out of their biggest strongholds.

entry.title: Iraq declares victory over Islamic State group in Tikrit
Iraqi forces drive Islamic State out of central Tikrit - PM
entry.summary: The U.S. Defense Department said it could confirm Iraqi security forces' "advancement into Tikrit to liberate the city center as well as other parts of the city" from Islamic State.

entry.title: Iraqi forces drive Islamic State out of central Tikrit: PM
entry.summary: A member of the Iraqi security forces checks his weapon in Tikrit, March 30, 2015.

entry.title: Iraq hails Tikrit 'liberation' after month-long battle
entry.summary: Iraqi army and police forces, as well as volunteers and Iran-backed Shiite militias, completely surrounded Tikrit within two weeks of launching the operation.

entry.title: Iraq's prime minister says troops have reached center of Tikrit in battle with Islamic State
entry.summary: The leader of Iraq's Popular Mobilization Units, a collaborative force made up mostly of Shiite militias, also said his fighters had rejoined the Tikrit operation, less than a week after announcing a boycott over U.S. involvement.

entry.title: Iraq premier: Troops in center of Islamic State-held Tikrit
entry.summary: Abdul-Wahab al-Saadi, the commander of the Salahuddin operation, said his forces fighting from the west were still 300 meters (325 yards) from the center of Tikrit.

entry.title: Iraq premier: Troops in center of Islamic State-held Tikrit
entry.summary:
In a statement on Twitter, Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi announced the "liberation of Tikrit" and congratulated Iraqi security forces on their "historic milestone."

But an official statement from his office said the troops "hoisted the Iraqi flag" over the Salahuddin provincial headquarters in Tikrit and are moving to control the entire city.

entry.title: Iraqi forces recapture government headquarters in Tikrit from Isis
entry.summary: "Our security forces arrived at the centre of the city of Tikrit and freed the southern and western sides, and are moving to take control of the entire city," Abadi said in a statement.

entry.title: Iraq forces retake government HQ in Tikrit from IS
entry.summary: Iraqi forces have retaken the Salaheddin provincial government headquarters in Tikrit from the Islamic State jihadist group, a significant advance in the battle to recapture the city, officials said today.

entry.title: AP PHOTOS: Iraqi forces struggle to take back Tikrit
entry.summary: The battle for Tikrit, Saddam Hussein's hometown, is seen as a key step toward eventually recapturing Mosul, the country's second largest city, which lies further north.

entry.title: AP PHOTOS: Iraqi forces struggle to take back Tikrit
entry.summary: The following is a selection of photos taken in Tikrit by AP photographer Khalid Mohammed, who is embedded with Iraqi forces.

entry.title: AP PHOTOS: Iraqi forces struggle to take back Tikrit
Shiite militias quit siege of Islamic State in Tikrit over US role
entry.summary:
The Badr Organisation's leader, Hadi al-Amiri, was shown on Iraqi television leading the ground fight in Tikrit on Thursday.

Since March 2, Islamic State forces in Tikrit have been under attack by the Iraqi militias, collectively known as the Popular Mobilisation Committees, and regular Iraqi military forces, together numbering more than 30,000 fighters.

entry.title: Shiite militias quit siege of Islamic State in Tikrit over US role
entry.summary: Iraqi security forces prepare to attack Islamic State extremist positions in Tikrit on Thursday.

entry.title: Iraq special forces advance in Tikrit, U.S. coalition joins fight
entry.summary: Coalition jets launched their first air strikes against Islamic State targets in Tikrit on Wednesday, coming off the sidelines to aid Iraqi forces against the Sunni Islamist militants.

entry.title: Air strikes trigger final push on Iraq's Tikrit
entry.summary: "Now the operation to take Tikrit really begins," one US defence official told AFP.

entry.title: After US airstrikes, Iraq troops start final push for Tikrit
entry.summary:
Iranian military advisers have been providing significant support since the Tikrit offensive began on March 2, arming and training the Iraqi Shiite militias, which have played a prominent role on the battlefield.

But the top U.S. general for the Middle East said Thursday that Iranian forces and Shiite militia have left the fight and pulled back from Tikrit as a condition to U.S. involvement.

entry.title: After US airstrikes, Iraq troops start final push for Tikrit
entry.summary: In an address late Wednesday, Iraq's Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi said Iraqi forces began the "final phase" in the Tikrit offensive but did not acknowledge that U.S.-led coalition forces were playing a direct role.

entry.title: After US Airstrikes, Iraq Troops Start Final Push for Tikrit
entry.summary: At Iraq's request, the U.S. began airstrikes on Tikrit on Wednesday in support of the stalled ground offensive, Lt. Gen. James L. Terry, the commander of the U.S.-led campaign to defeat the Islamic State group, said Wednesday.

entry.title: After US airstrikes, Iraq troops start final push for Tikrit
Air strikes trigger final push on Iraq's Tikrit
entry.summary: Iraqi forces buoyed by the first US-led coalition air strikes on Tikrit made a final push Thursday to flush diehard jihadists out of Saddam Hussein's hometown.

entry.title: Air strikes trigger final push on Iraq's Tikrit
entry.summary: "The ongoing Iraqi and coalition air strikes are setting the conditions for offensive action to be conducted by Iraqi forces currently surrounding Tikrit," Terry said.

entry.title: Top general: Iran-backed Shiite militia not in Tikrit fight
US launches Tikrit air strikes to support Iraqi forces
entry.summary: US and coalition aircraft bombed Islamic State jihadists in Tikrit, lending air power to Iraqi forces who have struggled to recapture the town despite Iranian assistance.

entry.title: Coalition, Iraqi planes target IS militants in Tikrit presidential compound: spokesman
entry.summary: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Coalition and Iraqi planes struck a sprawling complex of palaces in the city of Tikrit on Thursday where Islamic State militants have been holding out for more than three weeks, officials said.

entry.title: U.S. launches airstrikes against ISIS forces in Tikrit
entry.summary: A series of U.S. airstrikes north of Tikrit, in the vicinity of Beiji, in recent weeks has had the indirect benefit of tying down ISIS forces that might otherwise be operating in defense of Tikrit.

entry.title: US launches airstrikes to support Iraqi forces trying to dislodge ISIS militants from Tikrit
entry.summary: Col Steve Warren, a Pentagon spokesman, said Wednesday the Iraqi forces have encircled Tikrit but not yet made significant inroads into the heavily defended city limits.

entry.title: US launches Tikrit air strikes to support Iraqi forces
entry.summary: "I can confirm that the government of Iraq has requested coalition support for operations in Tikrit," Pentagon spokesman Colonel Steven Warren said.

entry.title: U.S. conducting airstrikes to help Iraq retake Tikrit
entry.summary: "We have started the final phase of the operation in Tikrit," he said.

entry.title: U.S.-led coalition, Iraqis pound Islamic State in Tikrit
US conducting airstrikes to help Iraq retake Tikrit
entry.summary: The official said Wednesday's attacks were the first in a series that would be carried out in the days to come as the coalition coordinates with Iraqi ground troops who have encircled Tikrit but not penetrated deeply into the city.

entry.title: US conducting airstrikes to help Iraq retake Tikrit
entry.summary: Tikrit is deemed an important test of the ability of Iraq, with coalition support, to retake ground it ceded to the Islamic State last year.

entry.title: U.S.-led coalition, Iraqis pound Islamic State in Tikrit
entry.summary:
A U.S. defense official, speaking on condition of anonymity, said American warplanes and aircraft from allied nations were striking up to a dozen targets in Tikrit, selected after coalition surveillance flights.

As coalition aircraft entered the fray, Iraqi forces pounded Islamic State positions in Tikrit, resuming an offensive that had stalled for almost two weeks.

entry.title: US conducting airstrikes to help Iraq retake Tikrit
entry.summary: A member of an Iraqi Shiite militant group called Imam Ali Brigades patrols in Tikrit, 130 kilometers (80 miles) north of Baghdad, Iraq, Wednesday, March 25, 2015.

entry.title: US conducting airstrikes to help Iraq retake Tikrit
Exclusive: U.S.-led coalition planning to carry out Tikrit strikes - source
entry.summary:
But the Pentagon and White House earlier on Wednesday confirmed that the U.S.-led coalition had started carrying out intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance flights over Tikrit.

Any strikes by the coalition in Tikrit would represent the biggest collaboration so far against the militants by Iraqi forces, Iranian-backed paramilitaries and their Iranian advisers on the ground, and the United States and its allies.

entry.title: Pentagon silent on Iraq's prediction of Tikrit air strikes
entry.summary: "We do not normally telegraph future operations, so I will not comment on that. He also mentioned that we were providing ISR over Tikrit. I am prepared to confirm that," Warren told a news briefing at the Pentagon.

entry.title: U.S. supporting operations in Tikrit -White House
entry.summary: Iraqi President Fouad Massoum on Wednesday said he expected the U.S.-led coalition would soon carry out air strikes in Tikrit.

entry.title: US has discussed possible Tikrit airstrikes with Iraq
entry.summary: On Tuesday, other officials said that at Baghdad's request the U.S.-led coalition had begun aerial surveillance over Tikrit and is sharing the collected intelligence with the Iraqi government.

entry.title: US has discussed possible Tikrit airstrikes with Iraq
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - American officials say Washington has been in discussions with the Iraqi government on the possibility of U.S. airstrikes to support the Iraqi ground offensive against a dug-in Islamic State group in Tikrit.

entry.title: US has discussed possible Tikrit airstrikes with Iraq
US mulls air strikes on Tikrit, aids Iraqis with 'eye in the sky'
entry.summary:
BAGHDAD: Washington is considering launching air strikes, possibly within days, to back up Iraqi and Shia forces battling to recapture Tikrit from the Islamic State jihadist group, US officials said.

Possible air strikes near Tikrit are "being discussed at a high level" and could be days or weeks away, a US official told AFP.

entry.title: US mulls air strikes on Tikrit, aids Iraqis with 'eye in the sky'
entry.summary:
A US-led coalition has targeted IS with air strikes and provided training and equipment to Iraqi forces, but had not previously announced direct assistance for the Tikrit operation, in which Iran has played a major role.

The operation to retake Tikrit, which involves thousands of Iraqi soldiers, police and forces known as Popular Mobilisation units, which are dominated by Shiite militias, began on March 2.

entry.title: Official: US-led aircraft flying over IS-held Tikrit
entry.summary: The Tikrit operation is the largest to date and requires careful air and ground coordination in order to minimize civilian casualties and damage to the city's infrastructure.

entry.title: Official: US-led aircraft flying over IS-held Tikrit
entry.summary: Steve Warren said Tuesday that the Iraqi ground operation against the Islamic State group has "stalled" and that the Tikrit operation "has not moved forward recently."

entry.title: Official: US-led aircraft flying over IS-held Tikrit
entry.summary:
The U.S. had previously said it was not taking part in the Tikrit offensive because it had received no request to do so from Baghdad.

He added that Soleimani had just left Tikrit after providing front-line assistance and advising since the start of the operation.

The Sunni city of Tikrit lies about 130 kilometers (80 miles) north of Baghdad.

entry.title: U.S. says would review any Iraqi request for help in Tikrit
Official: US-led force flying over Islamic State-held Tikrit
entry.summary: A senior Iraqi military official said that coalition is not providing airstrikes in support of the Tikrit operation at this time, but launched airstrikes in the nearby oil refinery town of Beiji on Tuesday.

entry.title: Iraq request for U.S.-led Tikrit air strikes 'imminent': diplomat
entry.summary:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Iraq's request to the U.S.-led coalition for air strikes in the campaign to retake Tikrit from Islamic State insurgents is "imminent", a senior diplomat from a Western nation that is part of the coalition told Reuters on Tuesday.

The coalition has been absent so far from the Tikrit campaign launched three weeks ago, the largest to be undertaken by the Iraqi forces and Iranian-backed Shi'ite Muslim militias since Islamic State overran a third of the country last year.

A military official within the coalition told Reuters on Tuesday that the coalition began providing intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance for the Tikrit operation on March 21 after a request from the Iraq government.

entry.title: Coalition official: US-led force providing surveillance flights over Islamic State-held Tikrit
US trains Iraqi forces as battle for Tikrit continues
entry.summary: Operations to recapture Tikrit have been on hold for nearly a week, with Iraqi officials saying they're trying to minimize casualties by not rushing the final assault.

entry.title: Iraq has not asked for airstrikes in Tikrit: Pentagon
entry.summary: Iraq has not made a formal request to the US-led coalition fighting the Islamic State group to provide air support in the country's offensive to retake Tikrit, a Pentagon spokesman said Thursday.

entry.title: No Iraq request for coalition air support in Tikrit campaign
entry.summary:
"We have not been asked by the Iraqi government to conduct air strikes in Tikrit," said the senior military official in the coalition, declining to speculate why.

U.S. Army Colonel Steve Warren, a Pentagon spokesman, said Iraqis initially had made statements indicating the fight to retake Tikrit was almost complete.

"We see now that essentially is not the case. The Iraqis' offensive forces ... essentially have Tikrit encircled ...," Warren said.

entry.title: Iraq's Tikrit offensive stalled by IS bombs
entry.summary:
Iraq's offensive to retake Tikrit from the Islamic State group was stalled Tuesday because of streets and buildings rigged with booby trap bombs and by the several hundred jihadists still holding out there.

Staff Lieutenant General Abdulwahab al-Saadi, commander for Salaheddin, told AFP Sunday his forces in Tikrit needed air support from the US-led coalition.

entry.title: Saddam Hussein's tomb levelled in drive to retake Tikrit
entry.summary: An Iraqi soldier inspects the demolished tomb of the late Iraqi president Saddam Hussein in Tikrit.

entry.title: Saddam Hussein?s tomb leveled after battles with ISIS
entry.summary:
Fighting intensified to the north and south of Saddam's hometown Sunday as Iraqi security forces vowed to reach the center of Tikrit within 48 hours.

Associated Press video from the village of Ouja, just south of Tikrit, shows all that remains of Saddam's once-lavish tomb are the support columns that held up the roof.

The extremist Islamic State group has controlled Tikrit since June, when it waged its lightning offensive that saw Iraq's second-largest city, Mosul, come under their control.

entry.title: Saddam's tomb suffers extensive damage in clashes between Iraqi forces, ISIS
entry.summary:
OUJA, Iraq -- The tomb of Iraq's late dictator Saddam Hussein was virtually levelled in heavy clashes between militants from the Islamic State group and Iraqi forces in a fight for control of the city of Tikrit.

Yazan al-Jubouri, a Sunni from Tikrit fighting alongside the Shiite militias, said that the Islamic State militants killed 16 of his relatives and kept his family living in horror.

entry.title: Iraqi Militia Loyal to Radical Cleric Joins Tikrit Offensive
entry.summary: Earlier this month, New York-based Human Rights Watch called on the Iraqi government to protect civilians in Tikrit and allow them to flee combat zones.

entry.title: Iraqi militia loyal to radical cleric joins Tikrit offensive
entry.summary:
BAGHDAD (AP) - Dozens of fighters with the militia loyal to radical Shiite cleric Muqtada al-Sadr left Iraq's capital Sunday to take part in an offensive to capture Tikrit from the Islamic State group.

Iraqi officials say that at least 30,000 men - including soldiers, Shiite militiamen, Sunni tribes and police officers - are fighting to seize Tikrit.

Al-Mousawi said the Peace Brigade are looking to fight alongside Tikrit's Sunni tribes to liberate the city, saying: "It's them who should lead this fight, since Tikrit is where their homes and families are."

entry.title: Iraqi troops pause, await back-up in battle for Tikrit against militants
entry.summary:
More than 20,000 troops and Iranian-backed Shi'ite fighters entered Tikrit on Wednesday, having retaken areas to the north and south in Iraq's biggest offensive against the militants yet.

More "well-trained forces" were needed for the street-by-street battles that recapturing the city would require, the source said, speaking by phone from Tikrit.

Military commanders had "reached a decision to halt the operation until a suitable, carefully set plan is in place" to break into central Tikrit, the source said.

entry.title: Iraqi forces pause in battle to drive Islamic State from Tikrit
entry.summary:
A source in the military command said Iraqi forces would not move forward until reinforcements reached Tikrit, of which Islamic State still holds around half.

A victory in Tikrit would give Iraqi forces momentum for the next stage of the campaign to retake Mosul, the largest city under control of Islamic State.

entry.title: Iraqi forces 'push into Tikrit'
Iraq seizes town on outskirts of Islamic State-held Tikrit
entry.summary:
By nightfall, the military sealed off Tikrit on all sides, the officials said, speaking on condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to talk to journalists.

The overt Iranian role and the prominence of Shiite militias in the campaign have raised fears of possible sectarian cleansing should Tikrit, an overwhelmingly Sunni city, fall to the government troops.

entry.title: Iraq seizes town on outskirts of Islamic State-held Tikrit
Top US general optimistic about outcome of Tikrit battle
entry.summary:
Army Gen. Martin Dempsey, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, was asked by reporters traveling with him from Washington to Iraq whether he believes the Islamic State group will be pushed out of Tikrit.

The offensive is not what the Americans would consider textbook military tactics, he said, describing a hodge-podge of Iraqi Humvees, trucks and other vehicles surging toward Tikrit like rush hour on the Washington Beltway.

Its fighters swept across much of northern and western Iraq last summer and now control numerous key cities, including Tikrit, which is the birthplace of former Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein.

entry.title: Top US general optimistic about outcome of Tikrit battle
entry.summary: MANAMA, Bahrain (AP) - The top U.S. general predicts the one-two punch of Iranian-backed militias and Iraqi government troops will prevail over Islamic State fighters in the unfolding battle for Tikrit, Saddam Hussein's hometown.

entry.title: Top US general optimistic about outcome of Tikrit battle
entry.summary: But in the Tikrit offensive, which began Monday, the U.S. is on the sidelines, watching as Iran asserts influence by providing training, weapons and leadership for Iraqi Shiite militias leading the charge on Tikrit.

entry.title: Top US general optimistic about outcome of Tikrit battle
Islamic State will be forced out of Tikrit, says top US general
entry.summary:
In the Tikrit offensive, which began Monday, the US is on the sidelines.

"The important thing about this operation in Tikrit is less about how the military aspect of it goes and more about what follows," Dempsey said.

entry.title: Fight for Iraqi city of Tikrit draws Tehran and Washington still closer together
entry.summary: It's unclear how many Iranian troops are on the ground for the campaign to wrest control of Salaheddin province, and the strategic city of Tikrit, back from IS, but some are.

entry.title: Fight for Iraqi city of Tikrit draws Tehran and Washington still closer together
entry.summary:
A volunteer Shiite fighter prepares to join the battle against IS for control of the Iraqi city of Tikrit.

A complaint by the Saudi Foreign Minister, Prince Saud al-Faisal, addressed the battle for Tikrit in particular - it was, he said, an indication of Iran's "hegemonic" tendencies.

entry.title: Islamic State torches oil field east of Tikrit
entry.summary:
Smoke rises from oil wells set alight by Islamic State in the Ajil field, east of the city of Tikrit, in the Salahuddin province.

Baghdad: Islamic State militants have set fire to oil wells north-east of the city of Tikrit to obstruct an assault by Shi'ite militia fighters and Iraqi soldiers trying to drive them from the area.

Black smoke could be seen rising from the oil field since Wednesday afternoon, said the witness, who accompanied Iraqi militia and soldiers as they advanced on Tikrit from the east.

They are likely to first attack the towns of al-Dour and al-Alam to the south and north of Tikrit.

entry.title: Iraq forces 'encircle IS in Tikrit'
entry.summary: A senior army commander said the operation was focused on preventing IS from launching more attacks, and cutting supply lines to stop reinforcements and weapons reaching Tikrit.

entry.title: Fierce clashes outside Iraq's Tikrit after new offensive
entry.summary:
Past attempts to retake Tikrit have failed, as Iraq struggles with a military that collapsed last summer during the Islamic State militants' lightning offensive.

The Tikrit operation is seen as a litmus test for the capability of Iraqi troops to dislodge the militants from major cities they conquered in the country's Sunni heartland.

entry.title: Fierce clashes outside Iraq's Tikrit after new offensive
entry.summary:
Tuesday marked the second day of the Iraqi advance on Tikrit, with soldiers supported by Iranian-backed Shiite militias and advisers, along with some Sunni tribal fighters who reject the Islamic State group.

Hikmat estimated the Iraqi force besieging Tikrit at some 25,000 people.

They said fierce clashes struck mainly outside the town of al-Dour, south of Tikrit, while government troops shelled militant bases inside the city.

entry.title: Iraq launches major offensive to retake Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary:
So far local reports indicated the army, backed by as many as 27,000 soldiers as well as Iraqi fighter jets and helicopters, had attacked the city from three sides but had yet to make it inside Tikrit.

Volunteer Shiite fighters fire an artillery canon near the city of Tikrit.

entry.title: Iraq launches major offensive to retake Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary:
Iraq's military says some 2,000 Shiite militia fighters have arrived near the town of Tikrit in preparation for a major operation.

Members of the Iraqi security forces head towards al-Dawr, south of Tikrit.

Tikrit was the scene of one of the first and largest massacres conducted by IS, when it kidnapped and murdered hundreds of Iraqi security forces from the nearby military base of Camp Speicher.

entry.title: Iraq launches major assault to retake Tikrit from Islamic State
entry.summary:
Iraqi forces have tried and failed several times to wrest back Tikrit, a Sunni Arab city on the Tigris river about 160 kilometres (100 miles) north of Baghdad.

Tikrit is the hometown of executed dictator Saddam Hussein, the remnants of whose Baath party have collaborated with IS in attempting to topple the Shiite-dominated government.

entry.title: Iraq third large-scale military operation to recapture Tikrit from ISIS faces major opposition
entry.summary:
But hours into the operation, a key test for the embattled Iraqi army, the military said it still hadn't entered the city of Tikrit, indicating a long battle lies ahead.

Any operation to take Mosul would require Iraq to seize Tikrit first because of its strategic location for military enforcements.

entry.title: Iraq launches major offensive to recapture Tikrit from ISIL
entry.summary: Government forces backed by allied Shia and Sunni fighters have begun a large-scale military operation to recapture Saddam Hussein's hometown of Tikrit from the Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

entry.title: Iraq launches operation to retake Tikrit from ISIS
entry.summary:
Tikrit is one of the largest cities held by ISIS and lies on the road connecting Baghdad to Mosul.

The U.S.-led coalition launching airstrikes targeting ISIS were not involved in the Tikrit operation, Iraqi officials said.

entry.title: News24.com | Operation to retake Tikrit from ISIS begins
entry.summary:
Al-Iraqiya television said on Monday that the forces were attacking the city of Tikrit, backed by artillery and airstrikes by Iraqi fighter jets.

Tikrit, some 130km north of Baghdad, fell into the hands of ISIS last summer along with the country's second-largest city of Mosul and other areas in Sunni heartland.
